content.heroIntro: MIRADOR HILLS represents a premier residential opportunity in the heart of Hacienda del Alamo, Fuente Álamo, Murcia. faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can freely purchase property in Spain without requiring Spanish residency. EU citizens have unrestricted rights, while non-EU citizens also enjoy purchasing freedom. You will need an NIE (tax identification number) for the transaction. We recommend consulting with a Spanish property lawyer to ensure compliance with all legal requirements.

faqs.question: What are the typical costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect additional costs including transfer tax (6-10% depending on region), notary fees (0.5-1%), property registration fees (0.1%), and legal fees (typically 1-2%). These costs are generally lower than many other European countries, and MIRADOR HILLS' lower starting price of €196,900 means total acquisition costs remain very reasonable.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa to buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: No, purchasing property does not require a visa. However, if you plan to reside in Spain, visa requirements depend on your nationality. EU citizens enjoy freedom of movement, while non-EU citizens may require appropriate residence permits depending on their circumstances. We recommend consulting with Spanish immigration authorities for specific requirements.
